actions.name: Activate Spadonari Dance
actions.detail:
Expend a charge to swap places with an adjacent ally. This movement – for both you and the target – ignores Engagement and does not trigger reactions. If your target is Grappled, you take their place in the Grapple.

Then, roll an Agility check. On a success, your target may immediately move up to 2 spaces in a direction of their choice. On a roll of 20+, you may replenish one charge of this System.

actions.name: Spin-Up Servos
actions.detail:
Until the end of your next turn, gain the following benefits:
  • You cannot be prevented from taking reactions
  • Whenever you would voluntarily move as part of a reaction, you may move 1 additional space
  • You may make all movement as though Hovering until the start of your next turn, at which point you land (this counts as falling without any damage)

name: Vasuki-Class NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI tag and Poison the Churning Ocean.

actions.name: Poison the Churning Ocean
actions.detail: 1/scene, compel your enemies’ animosity. Until the start of your next turn, you are Immobilized. All hostile characters within Line of Sight and Range equal to your Speed must make a Systems save. On a failed save, they must spend all their actions attacking you with melee attacks until the end of their next turn, prioritizing melee weapons. If you are not within Threat, they instead use all actions to move toward you as directly as possible.

name: The Gate of Opening
effect:
When you make an improvised attack, you may select one of the following effects. If you do, the attack does half damage.
  • Crush: The target makes a Hull save. On a failure, they are Shredded and Impaired until the end of their next turn.
  • Daze: The target makes an Agility save. On a failure, they are Immobilized until the end of their next turn, or by clearing the condition as a Quick action.
  • Disorient: The target makes a Systems save. On a failure, they cannot draw line of sight further than Sensors and make all attacks as though their target were Invisible until the end of their next turn.
  • Overwhelm: The target makes an Engineering save. On a failure, they are Slowed and cannot take any reactions until the end of their next turn.
description: Smash the barrier that guards your thoughts, and become unshackled. The Gates await you.

name: The Gate of Healing
effect:
1/round, after hitting an improvised attack, you may choose one of the following effects:
  • Reduce your current Heat by 1.
  • Gain 2 Overshield.
  • Clear a condition that was not caused by your own systems, talents, etc.
description: The journey to open the gates is unforgiving. To reach the end, you must treat yourself with the same kindness you would show to others, and hope others would show to themselves. The Gates will not be forgiving.

name: The Gates of Pain and Limit
description: When your body has reached its limit, extend past it. Push through the Gate of Pain. Destroy the Gate of Limit, and go beyond.

actions.name: The Gates of Pain and Limit
actions.detail:
Choose one of the following effects. It lasts until the end of the scene, or until you Unlock The Gates again.
  • The Gate of Pain: Your melee attacks gain Knockback +2. 1/round, when you knock a character into a wall, mech, or other obstruction that would cause it to stop moving, it takes 1d6 bonus Kinetic damage.
  • The Gate of Limit: Your melee attacks gain Smart and AP.

name: The Gate of View
description: Now eclipsing your natural form, your strength can reach the horizon. But be mindful – or it may leave you behind.

actions.name: Unlock The Gate of View
actions.detail:
Give a target in line of sight a Gate Mark. Only one Gate Mark can exist at a time – if you select another target for a Gate Mark, the first disappears.
As long as a character with a Gate Mark is in line of sight, you may target them with non-weapon, non-system actions as though they were adjacent to you. Any attack made this way deals Energy damage instead of Kinetic. On a critical hit, it may deal Burn instead.

name: The Gate of Wonder
description: Few make it this far. You are an odd talent, indeed. But be wary – you walk upon the edge of a knife. Falter even once and the Gates will shut.

actions.name: Unlock The Gate of Wonder
actions.detail: You may teleport up to twice your Speed. Then, until the end of your next turn, you are Exposed and Immobilized. You may then perform an improvised attack on each character within Burst 2.

name: Superfluous Hull
effect: Allies that are a smaller Size than you may end their turns in spaces you occupy. These characters are treated as adjacent for the purposes of your effects on allied characters (from your traits, talents, systems, or weapons). Gain the Splintering Shield reaction.

actions.name: Splintering Shield
actions.trigger: An adjacent ally is damaged by an attack.
actions.detail: Reduce the damage dealt to the target by half. You take that damage, and may create a Scrap Heap, a Size 1 object that can be used for hard cover, in a free space within Range 2.

name: Farragut-Class Ambulators
effect:
You may pass through spaces and end your turn in spaces occupied by Prone enemies that are the same Size or smaller than you. If you do, they become Crushed. As long as they are Crushed, they are Impaired, Immobilized, cannot take reactions, and take 2 AP Kinetic damage at the end of each of your turns.

Enemies stop being Crushed when you move out of all spaces they occupy, or if they succeed on a contested Hull check as a Quick Action, at which point they are immediately pushed back to the nearest open space.

name: Carrier Platform
effect: An allied character that is smaller than you may board you as a Quick action. While boarded, the smaller character occupies a space you occupy, and becomes Immobilized but moves when you move, mirroring your movement, but can still be attacked and targeted separately. They also benefit from soft cover, and are treated as being higher elevation to any non-flying characters. This effect lasts either for the rest of the scene, until this system is destroyed, or until they disembark as a Protocol, and are placed in an open space adjacent to you.

actions.name: Divert Power To Systems
actions.detail: Until the end of its next turn, the target’s next weapon attack automatically misses, but the next save or check it forces is made with +2 Difficulty.

actions.name: Divert Power To Weapons
actions.detail: Until the end of its next turn, the next check or save the target forces is automatically passed, but it makes its next weapon attack with +2 Accuracy.

name: Tomographic Projector
effect: As a Quick Action, expend a charge to deploy a Tomographic Projector drone that attaches to any object or surface within Sensors.

deployables.name: Tomographic Projector
deployables.detail:
When deployed (or re-deployed), Tomographic Projectors are Hidden, even if they are not in cover, until they are found with Search.

You may take the Scan quick action against any character within Range 5 of a Tomographic Projector drone as though it were within Sensors and line of sight. When you do, you also Discover a Vulnerability in the target. They receive Lock On and take +1d6 bonus damage the next time they take damage from an attack between now and the end of your next turn.

actions.name: Thermal Equilibrium
actions.detail: At the start of the target’s next turn, set their current Heat to half of their Heat Cap, putting them in the Danger Zone. This can only be used 1/scene on each character.

actions.name: Destabilize Corporeality
actions.detail: The target is Intangible until the end of their next turn. They may end this effect early by succeeding on an Engineering check as a quick action. This can only be used 1/scene on each character.

name: Kawarimi Decoy
effect: As a Quick action, expend a charge to deploy the decoy drone to any object or surface within Sensors.

deployables.name: Kawarimi Decoy
deployables.detail: Gain the Kawarimi reaction, which can be taken once for each deployed Kawarimi Decoy.

actions.name: Kawarimi
actions.trigger: An allied character within Range 5 of the drone is hit by an attack.
actions.detail: They may swap places with the drone as though teleporting, as long as there is sufficient space. The drone receives the damage and effects of the attack instead.
